title.native: カードキャプターさくら クリアカード編

description:
The power of the Clow is back! As Sakura settles into a normal routine, she prepares to face her newest challenge - junior high! While her classes are challenging, things start looking up when Xiaolang Li reappears and says he'll be staying for good. But when she has a strange dream about a mysterious figure and wakes to find her Clow Cards completely clear, she must return to her duty as Cardcaptor.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Cheerleading
tags.description: Centers around the activity of cheerleading.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

node.description: [Website](http://www.clamp-net.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CLAMP_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/clamp_4_official/) CLAMP is an all-female Japanese manga artist group that formed in the mid-1980s. It consists of leader [Nanase Ohkawa](https://anilist.co/staff/97292), and three artists who shift roles for each series: [Mokona](https://anilist.co/staff/100802) (もこな), [Tsubaki Nekoi](https://anilist.co/staff/100804), and Satsuki Igarashi (いがらし寒月). Almost 100 million CLAMP tankōbon copies have been sold worldwide as of October 2007. In general, Ohkawa gets her inspiration for the group from everyday events such as dreams or the news. Unlike most manga artists who specialize in a single genre, CLAMP has created a diverse body of work. CLAMP's genres vary widely, from childish and comedic (Cardcaptor Sakura, Clamp School Detectives) to more dramatic and teen-rated (xxxHolic, X) series. Furthermore, drawing from the idea of Osamu Tezuka's Star System as they did in Tsubasa: Reservoir Chronicle, CLAMP often crossover characters from their own series into their other works, which gives rise to a loosely defined "Clamp Universe".

Asaka joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) after graduating from Osaka Designers' College. There his first job was working as an assistant director for [Toshio Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/117533/) on [Phoenix: Yamato Chapter](https://anilist.co/anime/2999/). Later he made his debut as an episode director on [Yawara!](https://anilist.co/anime/691/), and soon after as a director on [Pops](https://anilist.co/anime/2093). His notable works include [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/), [Nana](https://anilist.co/anime/877/), [Chihayafuru](https://anilist.co/anime/10800/), and [My Love Story!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20946/) among others.

Many of his works take on a female perspective for the telling of the story, with a feminine protagonist as the central focus. This has contributed to him becoming the main director at Madhouse for handling the more serious series featuring female characters or targeting the female market.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/7se_ohkawa)

One of the members of [CLAMP](https://anilist.co/staff/96877/CLAMP) an all female Mangaka group.  Wrote under the credit of Ageha Ohkawa for a while but has recently returned to her name Nanase.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/7se_ohkawa)

One of the members of [CLAMP](https://anilist.co/staff/96877/CLAMP) an all female Mangaka group.  Wrote under the credit of Ageha Ohkawa for a while but has recently returned to her name Nanase.

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.
**Shimizu Tomoyuki (清水友幸)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

__Favorite Colors:__ Pink, brown
__Hobbies:__ Performing, reading, singing

[Official Website](http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/sakamotomaaya/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaya_Sakamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E7%9C%9F%E7%B6%BE)

Married frequent costar [Kenichi Suzumura](https://anilist.co/staff/95005) on August 8, 2011.

[Website](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/suzuki-minori.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minoringo_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7f1T-CF50uNMmGK_I9cILQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3Ath9xfI4WBdrZPFQ4VX9A?si=RqHEeCs9Sci2RtrWnmqvfQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minoringo_official/)

She got picked out of 8000 people for the role of [Freyja Wion](https://anilist.co/character/90101/Freyja-Wion). She had no prior voice acting work.

Minori Suzuki is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

[Website](https://avex.jp/kiyono-yasuno/) | [Blog](https://profile.ameba.jp/ameba/kiyono-yasuno) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yaskiyo_manager) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%AE%89%E9%87%8E%E5%B8%8C%E4%B8%96%E4%B9%83) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEQScK4V7gy34xEFGjNH6Hw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kiyonon_at_home/)

Kiyono's hobbies are watching stage plays, films, comics / manga and singing karaoke.

Kiyono Yasuno is a member of the real-life idol group [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

__Non-Anime Roles__
- Palema - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
- [Hoshiguma](https://anilist.co/character/174800/) - Arknights (VG)
- Ade - Goddess of Victory: NIKKE (VG)
- Pearl - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) since 2002.

Debuted as a character designer on [Boogiepop and Others](https://anilist.co/anime/101283/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/sawa_zawazawa)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/unchng_stin) | [Tumblr](https://moaang.tumblr.com/)

A Korean freelance animator currently working in Japan.
